intro: Pentacalia guadalupe subsp. caucana, commonly known as the Guadalupe caucana, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. The species is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered plant species.
